isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE / 9200 9300 9400 MODELS BUILT AFTER JANUARY 1, 1995 - ELECTRONIC ENGINE CONTROLS - CUMMINS CELECT -1991 - SYSTEM COMPONENTS AND OPERATION

svcproc.title: General System Components
svcproc.para: Electronic Control Module (ECM) - The ECM receives 12 volt battery power from the vehicle batteries and sends low voltage signals (5 volt) to the system components. The system components then ground back through the ECM.

The ECM receives 12 volt battery power from the ECM Power Connector (225) on circuits 97 and 97A. There are two 10 AMP Cummins fuses to protect the ECM. The ECM is grounded to the starter terminal on circuit 97-G.
The ECM 9-way connector (251) also receives ignition power (circuit 13D) from circuit breaker D3 (5 AMP).

The signals from the ECM to the system switches and components are from ECM terminal #10 on circuit 97WZ(5V) to a slice in the cab overlay harness where the signal is then distributed to the individual devices. The ECM has two connectors, a 9-pin connector and a 28-pin connector, that are used for International connections.

Instrument Cluster Warning Lights - The "Oil/Water," "Engine Warning" and "Engine Stop" lights receive ignition power from J1 Ignition Connector on circuit 28A. The warning lights ground to the ECM (terminals 1, 25 & 16). The ECM turns the lights on or off in response to engine conditions by closing or opening the ground path. See TROUBLESHOOTING for warning light operation.
Data Link Connector (137) -The 8-pin Diagnostic Connector has four active pins.

step1.para: Pin 1 is the Data Link (+) connection to the ECM (terminal 27) through J11 (red data link connector) on circuit 98(+).
Pin 2 is the Data Link (-) connection to the ECM (terminal 8) through J10 (blue data link connector) on circuit 98C(-).
Pin 3 receives ignition power (with the key switch in the ON position) on circuit 97DL from the ignition terminal of the key switch through fuse D4 (5 AMP).
Pin 5 is a ground connection to J7 cab ground.

svcproc.para: Diagnostic On/Off Switch (241) - The Diagnostic On/Off Switch receives a signal from the ECM (circuit 97AN(5V)) and is grounded to the ECM (terminal 21).
Idle/Diagnostic Switch (243) - The Idle Diagnostic Switch receives a signal from the ECM (circuit 97AX(5V) and is grounded to the ECM at terminals 14 (increment position) and 23 (set position).

Service Brake Pedal Switch (253) - The Service Brake Switch is closed when the brake pedal is released. The switch receives a signal from the ECM on circuit 97WZ(5V) and is grounded to the ECM (terminal 13).

Accelerator Pedal APS/IVS (242) -The electronic accelerator pedal assembly includes the Accelerator Position Sensor (APS) and the Idle Validation Switch (IVS). The 6-pin connector receives a low voltage signal from the ECM (99D(5V) and on circuit 99A(5V). Circuit 99-G grounds the unit to the ECM (terminal 19) and circuits 99B, 99C and 99 connect to the ECM.

Low Coolant Level Switch (249) - The Low Coolant Switch receives a signal from the ECM through the 9-way ECM connector (circuit 34B(5V) and is grounded with circuit 34-G through the 9-way ECM connector (terminal J). Circuits 34A and 34 connect to the ECM 9-way connector.
